about.about: Hyperion is distinguished by its irregular shape, its chaotic rotation, and its unexplained sponge-like appearance. It was the first non-round moon to be discovered.
about.discovery: Discovered by William Cranch Bond, George Phillips Bond and William Lassell in 1848.
about.name: The moon is named after Hyperion, the Titan god of watchfulness and observation – the elder brother of Cronus, the Greek equivalent of Saturn – in Greek mythology.
